intro: Pedicularis rosea, commonly known as the pink fairywand, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant is characterized by its striking pink or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. Pedicularis rosea is often found growing in rocky or mountainous habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
